intro: Brassica rapa stirps oblonga, commonly known as Chinese mustard or field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and segmented fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small, triangular, and often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The plant is also a common weed in agricultural fields and can be a host for various pests and diseases.
